post_text: The PGSD has reached out to the Calcasieu School District that experienced damage to 97 percent of its schools during Hurricane Laura. These photos show some of the damages at Vincent Settlement Elementary School, and we have spoken with the principal there, Carla Williams, via email. It may be 60 days before campuses are clean enough and electricity restored so that classes can resume at the district's 60-plus school sites. Many teachers and students have lost their homes. Please participate in the PGSD's fundraiser to help this school district's families get back on their feet. Just as we were grateful for help from many people in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, our neighbors now need our help. #workofheart

The Fab Lab helps develop deep critical thinking skills necessary for preparing future innovators.

GHS's Mikayah Buckley Wins Volunteer Service Award!

Congratulations to Gautier High School senior Mikiyah Buckley for winning the President’s Volunteer Service Award through the Corporation for National & Community Service.
In 2003, the President’s Council on Service and Civic Participation founded the President’s Volunteer Service Award to recognize the important role of volunteers in America’s strength and national identity. This award honors individuals whose service positively impacts communities in every corner of the nation and inspires those around them to take action, too.
Mikiyah, a Collegiate Academy student, obtained her volunteer service hours at Martin Bluff Elementary School, Gautier High School, and Good Hope Missionary Baptist Church. She hosted a Thanksgiving drive for non-perishable food items last fall at Gautier High School.

Jordan was a teacher at George County Middle School and coach for the middle school softball team for four years. After the game, Gautier Middle School Softball Coach Jennifer Peterson gave George County Coach Sam Compston a sympathy card signed by all the Gautier Gators for the George County team. “Next thing we knew, the entire George County team came over - tears streaming down their faces - and hugged our team,” Peterson said. Coach Compston told Peterson that the George County parents and players were amazed at the care & compassion shown to them by our Gautier team! “It was very emotional,” Coach Peterson said. The PGSD’s thoughts and prayers go out to the family, friends and school family of Coach Steven Jordan during this difficult time. #bethelight
